intro: Sophronanthe pilosa, commonly known as the hairy sophronanthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Sophronanthe pilosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
